result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry Jaquane Gray Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay the  DNA sample, pay all mandatory court costs, fees and assessments.  Pay by 3/21/2016 or serve 10 days in HOC.

Concurrent with: Concurrent to case 14CF3021 and consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. stats to apply for medical and school and release to the Day Reporting Center.

Court advised defendant he will have to provide a DNA sample to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry Jaquane Gray Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay as ordered.  10 days HOC.  Due & owing

Defendant Jerry Jaquane Gray in court with Student Intern, Gabriela Leija, under the supervision of attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT TO CASE 14CF3021, and consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 12 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for MEDICAL and school, and release to the Day reporting center.

- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, and assessments, by 3/21/2016 or serve 10 days in the HOC. 

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Jerry Jaquane Gray in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for sentencing.  Defendant has a new case, and defense requests an adjournment.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 9/19/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jerry Jaquane Gray in court with attorney Caitlin Firer for attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 7/17/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Jerry Jaquane Gray in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Stephan Nolten.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 5/19/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to comply with Justice Point.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Jerry Jaquane Gray in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel request more time to go over discovery.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 3/28/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to go to Justice Point after court.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

COURT ORDERS DEFENDANT REMOVED FROM GPS ELECTRONIC MONITORING.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Court orders Drug Testing and No possession or use of controlled substances without valid prescription.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail AMENDED TO $2500 SIGNATURE BOND.

Defendant Jerry Jaquane Gray in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Jerry Jaquane Gray in custody.  Paul Hauer for Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and Electronic Monitoring.  To be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Jerry Jaquane Gray in court with attorney Anne Jaspers.  Defendant Jerry Jaquane Gray in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
